skill.name: regulatory-affairs-head
skill.description: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic regulatory guidance, submission management, regulatory pathway analysis, global compliance coordination, and cross-functional team leadership. Use for regulatory strategy development, submission planning, regulatory risk assessment, and team coordination activities.
skill.summary: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: All 42 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified regulatory terminology (C2 Module, HIPAA, Notified Body) and documentation syntax (markdown backticks, JSON structure) as security threats. The single Python script only performs local JSON file I/O for submission tracking with no network access, external commands, or sensitive data exposure. This is a legitimate regulatory affairs guidance skill.

content.value_statement: HealthTech and MedTech companies need expert regulatory guidance to navigate complex FDA and EU MDR requirements. This skill provides strategic regulatory affairs leadership including submission planning, compliance frameworks, and cross-functional team coordination for successful market access.
actual_capabilities: Develop FDA and EU MDR regulatory submission strategies
Create and manage regulatory submission timelines and tracking
Analyze regulatory pathways for medical devices and HealthTech products
Assess and mitigate regulatory risks throughout product lifecycle
Generate compliance status reports for regulatory submissions
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or regulatory certification
Cannot submit applications directly to regulatory authorities
Does not replace qualified regulatory affairs professionals for critical decisions
Reference guides may not reflect latest regulatory updates

use_cases.title: Build Submission Strategy
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive regulatory strategy for new medical device launch with FDA and EU MDR requirements

use_cases.title: Plan Market Entry Timeline
use_cases.description: Create regulatory pathway analysis and submission timeline for bringing innovative health technology to market

use_cases.title: Coordinate Compliance Activities
use_cases.description: Align cross-functional teams on regulatory requirements and submission milestones

prompt_templates.title: Basic Submission Help
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me understand the FDA 510(k) submission requirements for a Class II medical device. What documentation do I need?

prompt_templates.title: EU MDR Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the key steps for EU MDR 2017/745 compliance for a Class IIa diagnostic device? How do I engage with a Notified Body?

prompt_templates.title: Risk Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a regulatory risk assessment for our proposed product changes. What are the potential impacts on our existing FDA clearances?

prompt_templates.title: Team Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a regulatory team coordination plan for our upcoming PMA submission including milestones, responsibilities, and communication protocols.

output_examples.input: What do I need for an FDA 510(k) submission for a blood glucose monitor?
output: 510(k) Submission Requirements for Blood Glucose Monitor:
Classification: Likely Class II (special controls apply)
Predicate device: Identify comparable cleared devices
Performance testing: Accuracy, precision, linearity studies
Software documentation: If includes software/SaMD components
Labeling: Instructions for use, intended use statements
Quality system: 21 CFR Part 820 compliance required
Timeline: Typically 90 days substantive review after acceptance

output_examples.input: What are the clinical evidence requirements under EU MDR for a Class IIa device?
output: EU MDR Clinical Evidence Requirements for Class IIa:
Clinical evaluation plan per Annex XIV required
Literature review demonstrating equivalence to predicate devices
Clinical investigation if equivalence cannot be demonstrated
Post-market clinical follow-up (PMCF) plan mandatory
Clinical evaluation report updated throughout device lifecycle
Notified Body review of clinical evidence required

output_examples.input: How do I coordinate regulatory activities across my cross-functional team?
output: Cross-Functional Regulatory Team Coordination:
Weekly: Team meetings and cross-functional status updates
Monthly: Regulatory committee strategic planning sessions
Quarterly: Compliance training and assessment activities
Key stakeholders: Regulatory, Quality, R&D, Clinical, Manufacturing
Handoff requirements: Clear documentation for all interactions
Communication protocols: Standardized templates for regulatory updates

best_practices: Engage with regulatory authorities early through pre-submission meetings to identify potential issues
Maintain comprehensive documentation throughout the development process for smoother submissions
Track regulatory changes proactively as FDA and EU MDR requirements evolve frequently
anti_patterns: Waiting until development is complete before starting regulatory planning
Assuming previous clearances automatically apply to modified or new products
Underestimating the clinical evidence requirements for novel medical devices

faq.question: Does this skill work with Codex or only Claude?
faq.answer: This skill is optimized for Claude and Claude Code. Some prompts may work with Codex but FDA and EU guidance is Claude-specific.

faq.question: What regulatory frameworks are covered?
faq.answer: Primary coverage includes FDA 510(k), PMA, De Novo and EU MDR 2017/745. ISO 13485 and global pathways are referenced.

faq.question: Can this replace a regulatory affairs consultant?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and information but does not constitute legal or professional regulatory advice for specific products.

faq.question: Is my submission data secure?
faq.answer: Yes. The tracking script stores data locally in JSON files. No data is transmitted externally or accessed by third parties.

faq.question: Why is my submission taking longer than expected?
faq.answer: Regulatory timelines vary based on device complexity, authority workload, and completeness of applications. Additional information requests commonly cause delays.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a regulatory consultant?
faq.answer: This skill provides general guidance for common scenarios. Complex products or novel devices typically require specialized regulatory consultants.
